snippet: At the D: All Things Digital technology conference, what's reverberating through the conference is the change in the air in every aspect of technology. The word of the week has clearly been "disruption."
abstract: At the D: All Things Digital technology conference, what's reverberating through the conference is the change in the air in every aspect of technology. The word of the week has clearly been "disruption."

headline.main: At All Things Digital Conference, Talk of Disruptions

snippet: Arriva, which produced a set of behind-the-head earbuds for the iPod Shuffle, has a new gadget with Bluetooth.
abstract: Arriva, which produced a set of behind-the-head earbuds for the iPod Shuffle, has a new gadget with Bluetooth.

snippet: Mike Daisey was last seen apologizing for exaggerations and falsehoods in his influential one-man show "The Agony and Ecstasy of Steve Jobs" about the working conditions at the Chinese factories that make many Apple devices. This week he introduce...
abstract: Mike Daisey was last seen apologizing for exaggerations and falsehoods in his influential one-man show "The Agony and Ecstasy of Steve Jobs" about the working conditions at the Chinese factories that make many Apple devices. This week he introduced another Apple-centric performance, with unwilling co-stars the journalists who run the technology news site All Things D.

headline.main: Mike Daisey Returns to the Apple Story, With Tech Journalists as Targets

snippet: The wildly popular Kinect bred a rich subculture of techies dreaming up new uses for it.
Also, more questions in Britain over News Corporation's bid to own BSkyB, and a first-edition copy of "The Book of Mormon" has been stolen.
abstract: Also, more questions in Britain over News Corporation's bid to own BSkyB, and a first-edition copy of "The Book of Mormon" has been stolen.

headline.main: The Breakfast Meeting: Publishers Blame Amazon, and a 'Mental Mincemeat' Maker

snippet: Steven P. Jobs died nearly eight months ago, but the technology industry is not ready to let him go. At a technology conference where he frequently spoke, his close friends -- and those whose lives intersected with his -- spoke of him fondly.
abstract: Steven P. Jobs died nearly eight months ago, but the technology industry is not ready to let him go. At a technology conference where he frequently spoke, his close friends -- and those whose lives intersected with his -- spoke of him fondly.

headline.print_headline: Nostalgia Lingers For Steve Jobs In the Tech World

snippet: In response to a Justice Department lawsuit, the two book publishers denied any price fixing for e-books and accuse Amazon of engaging in anticompetitive behavior.
abstract: Book publishers Penguin Group USA and Macmillan, in response to a Justice Department lawsuit accusing five publishers of conspiring with Apple to fix the price of e-books, deny any e-book price fixing and accuse Amazon of engaging in anticompetitive behavior.

headline.main: 2 Publishers Deny Claim of E-Book Price Fixing
headline.print_headline: 2 Publishers Deny Claim of E-Book Price Fixing

snippet: Buying a smartphone means wading through a number of specialized terms, like 3G, 4G, CDMA and GSM. Here is a guide to some of them.
abstract: Guidelines for deciphering the ever-growing list of technical terms that marketers use to advertise smartphones, including the difference between 3G, 4G and other forms of connectivity.

headline.main: A Guide to Deciphering the Language of Smartphones

snippet: A reporter imagines when the world will be completely wireless and digital and how much the products will cost.
abstract: Latest digital media devices, which rely on streaming and cloud-based data, are making obsolete physical storage formats that once vied with each other for consumer loyalty.
